CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ophelia Hopson, 309 Paulson Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 21, 1958, pg.5 with question: "Do you think that the city needs a fair housing ordinance?" answer reads: �It is needed because a person should be able to buy in whatever neighborhood he wishes and can afford.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ophelia Hopson, wearing light colored polka dot dress, dark belt, light colored sweater, and earrings, holding glove in left hand, standing on sidewalk with pedestrians and buildings, including one with sign that reads "...eas"
